ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Some Spanish, with a focus on grammar.
I obviously learned a lot about Spanish, but overall, I think I learned how to study for a language better.
Basic spanish skills, some cultural knowledge.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The grading is brutal and the expectations are unreasonable. Doing one assignment, I asked one of my native-speaking friends for help, and she could not understand our assignment either.

Strengths -- You are forced to engage with the material on a daily basis, forcing you to really absorb the material Weaknesses -- The course is so fast paced and oftentimes very difficult to keep up with
Taught a lot of grammar but too much focus on cultural aspects that felt unnecessary.
No weaknesses. Strengths were how much you were forced to do daily.

I thought it was a good course, evaluations and comprehensive and pretty fair, we move at an appropriate pace and the in-class activities are helpful. It is much harder than Spanish 1 however, so be prepared.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes but be ready to work.
I would recommend this course to another student, you do learn a lot and I feel like my Spanish improved greatly.
